Text.Page: <PCNAME> went to Hagand to ask for help recharging the Relativity Stone. Hagand told <PCNAME> how he once explored the habitat himself when he was young. Hagand prepared a special potion to arm <PCNAME> for entering the dangerous area.
Hagand will want to speak to you, before you leave. Look for him inside the building there.<NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"I will."</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>

Welcome, outlander. The researchers you rescued say that your name is , and that you were present when High Elder Verikam was abducted. Momentous.

Now, what were you doing in this area in the first place?"I'm looking for Diranas Quarry."

Hmm. Halran sent you? Or Garm? I do not suppose they warned you of the danger...?

Of course not. Listen well: When I last visited that area, it was under control of archdevas and akanons. I was able to get around using an invisibility potion...and fortunately for you I have some left. I have no further use for it, so it is yours.

But! I recommend it trying it under controlled conditions first."No time like the present."

Hmm. You're not invisible. If anything, you look a bit green.

As I feared, this potion has passed its expiration date. I should have thrown it out years ago."Any way we could make a new one?"

There is always a way, when there is a will.

I have all I need here, save two ingredients. Would you be willing to retrieve them?

First, I shall need Reflective Root, to confuse the casual onlooker.

Second, Foggy Eyeballs, to confound the intent gaze.
Both are relatively common nearby, if perhaps a bit difficult to gather."Get started, then. I'll bring back the ingredients."

Back so soon? Ten years ago, it took me a week to get those ingredients!

Luckily, the potion is nearly finished. I just need you to be patient a moment longer."Take your time. Do it right."

Finished!


Now, listen carefully: This potion will not last forever, so do not drink it until you reach Diranas Quarry. Then collect the stones and leave at once.

And remember: There will be no warning when the potion wears off.
"I understand."
